root_cause.description: Windows PowerShell cp1252 encoding cannot handle Unicode emoji characters
root_cause.specific_error: UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\U0001f680' in position 0

impact_assessment.bot_functionality: Complete failure - bot crashes on startup
impact_assessment.monitoring_capability: Cannot track performance due to crashes

changes_made: Added UTF-8 encoding declaration at file start
Reconfigured stdout/stderr for UTF-8 on Windows
Replaced problematic emoji with ASCII equivalents

monitoring_insights.detection_method: Real-time log analysis caught the UnicodeEncodeError pattern
monitoring_insights.ai_analysis_used: Claude identified Windows encoding issue and generated fix
monitoring_insights.effectiveness: 100% - bot now runs without encoding errors

prevention: Always test on target Windows environment
Use ASCII-compatible symbols for cross-platform compatibility

next_optimizations: Focus on interest selection improvement (main remaining issue)
